required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects of Protein Supplementation in Females and Males Following Acute Eccentric Exercise
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Protein Supplementation in Females and Males Following Acute Eccentric Exercise

brief_summary.textblock: Examine the impact of the protein supplements leucine, HMB and BCAA on muscle recovery and inflammatory response following acute exercise.

detailed_description.textblock: Participants, both females and males, will perform an acute bout of exercise. A bout of exercise that will involve multiple drop jumps. Prior to and post exercise, functional outputs will be measured and blood will be collected to quantify the inflammatory response. The protocol will involve attending the laboratory on 6 occasions over a two week period to complete the above measures.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Randomised control study with four groups, one control and three protein supplements.

primary_outcome.measure: Concentration of Creatine Kinase at baseline
primary_outcome.description: Blood taken from either vein or finger will be analysed for creatine kinase, a marker of muscle damage.

primary_outcome.measure: Concentration of Creatine Kinase immediately after intervention.
primary_outcome.description: Blood taken from either vein or finger will be analysed for creatine kinase, a marker of muscle damage.

primary_outcome.description: Stand and sit on chair consecutively for 30 seconds with hands placed on hips.

primary_outcome.measure: Squat Jump height at baseline
primary_outcome.description: Hands placed on hips, feet shoulder width apart. Bend knees to approx 45 degrees hold for 3 seconds and jump maximally.

primary_outcome.measure: Range of motion at baseline.
primary_outcome.description: Sit on chair, then flex and extend legs three times from 90 degrees position.

primary_outcome.measure: Range of motion immediately after intervention.
primary_outcome.description: Sit on chair, then flex and extend legs three times from 90 degrees position.

primary_outcome.measure: Inflammatory cytokines concentration at baseline
primary_outcome.description: Blood from vein will be analysed for 10 different cytokines. Different cytokines include interleukins 1 beta, 2, 3, 4, 7, 8, 10, 17 and tutor necrosis factor receptor 1.

primary_outcome.measure: Inflammatory cytokines concentration at 24 hours after intervention.
primary_outcome.description: Blood from vein will be analysed for 10 different cytokines. Different cytokines include interleukins 1 beta, 2, 3, 4, 7, 8, 10, 17 and tutor necrosis factor receptor 1.

primary_outcome.measure: Inflammatory cytokines concentration at 48 hours after intervention.
primary_outcome.description: Blood from vein will be analysed for 10 different cytokines. Different cytokines include interleukins 1 beta, 2, 3, 4, 7, 8, 10, 17 and tutor necrosis factor receptor 1.

primary_outcome.measure: Inflammatory cytokines concentration at 7 days after intervention.
primary_outcome.description: Blood from vein will be analysed for 10 different cytokines. Different cytokines include interleukins 1 beta, 2, 3, 4, 7, 8, 10, 17 and tutor necrosis factor receptor 1.

primary_outcome.measure: Concentration of Lactate from baseline to immediately after intervention.
primary_outcome.description: Blood drop from finger will be used to lactate.

primary_outcome.measure: Muscle Soreness
primary_outcome.description: Record soreness on visual analogue scale from 1-10 1 = low soreness, 10 = extreme soreness.

secondary_outcome.description: Fill out dietary intake on food diary, by weighing food.

arm_group.description: Control group that was not given a supplement.
Supplement group that was given Branched Chain Amino Acids (BCAA).
Supplement group that was given Leucine.
Supplement group that was given β-Hydroxy β-methylbutyric acid (HMB)

intervention.description: Perform 100 drop jumps from 40 cm height. The protocol is divided into 5 sets of 20 repetitions. Between each repetition participants get 10 seconds, and between each set 2 minutes rest. Stand on the box, drop of the box and land with feet shoulder width apart. Then immediately bend knee to approx 45 degrees and jump straight up. Throughout each jump hands are placed on hips and should not move.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Health recreationally active males and females.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Asthma sufferers
- People with kidney disease
- People partaking in lower limb strength training
- People suffering DOMS in the past 6 months
- People already taking dietary supplements, other NSAIDs, or for example aspirin, alcohol, warfarin, phenytoin, methotrexate, lithium, diuretics, cyclosporine.
- People with bone or soft tissue injury within last 12 months
- People with gastric problems
- People with hypertension
- People who have had history of heart failure
- People with liver disease
- People with connective tissue disorders
- People with Crohn's disease
- People with ulcerative colitis
- People with peripheral arterial disease
- People with cerebrovascular disease
- Elderly population
- People with allergies to NSAIDs, Omega- 3 fatty acids and BCAAs.
- People with depression
- People with bipolar disorder
- People with diabetes
- Females who are pregnant
- People who have HIV / AIDS

reference.citation: Howatson G, Hoad M, Goodall S, Tallent J, Bell PG, French DN. Exercise-induced muscle damage is reduced in resistance-trained males by branched chain amino acids: a randomized, double-blind, placebo controlled study. J Int Soc Sports Nutr. 2012 Jul 12;9:20. doi: 10.1186/1550-2783-9-20. eCollection 2012.

Kirby TJ, Triplett NT, Haines TL, Skinner JW, Fairbrother KR, McBride JM. Effect of leucine supplementation on indices of muscle damage following drop jumps and resistance exercise. Amino Acids. 2012 May;42(5):1987-96. doi: 10.1007/s00726-011-0928-9. Epub 2011 May 12.
